sentence.idiomatic: I have been looking forward to meeting you for a long time. I'm honored that you came.
Although I am not your student, I've been looking forward to meeting you for a long time.
We have looked forward to meeting you for a long time since hearing about your beauty, and as soon as we saw you today, we were very impressed.
We are very honored that Mr. Li is able to welcome us personally.
I feel very honored to be able to interview with your company.
We feel so honored that you are attending our wedding.
You absolutely cannot call me an author. I don't deserve it at all.
Expert? No, you flatter me! I only know a little bit.
You praise me this way, I really don't deserve it. You are much better than me.
We again would like to express our thanks to our honored guests and friends for attending this party.
We are very privileged to invite Miss Wu to be our guest of honor for the program today.
Which of the honored guests attended the previous activity?
Thank you for the attentive reception, we had a wonderful time.
Is there anything unsatisfactory in our arrangements?
The service in this restaurant is not attentive at all.

word.literal: is or is not able to

sentence.idiomatic: I wonder if you will do me the honor of having dinner with me?
No matter how we invite him, he is still not willing to honor us with his presence.
Many thanks to everyone for their presence. You will be our most honored guests.
Everyone had a contribution to the success of this activity.
If I'm able to pass this test, all credit goes to my mother, who studied with me every day.
We got first place. Whose contribution was the largest?
I hope you can forgive my shortcomings.
Please forgive my horrible dancing.
This is my personal opinion. Please forgive me if it's incorrect.
Is it possible to find something in the world that everyone considers perfect?
Since someone was able to point out an error, this shows that our plan is not yet perfect.
I have never seen such a flawless performance. They are really the most outstanding actors.

word.literal: a perfect match between a man and a woman

sentence.idiomatic: Everybody said they were a perfect match and never imagined they would end up getting divorced.

word.literal: a perfect match between a man and a woman

sentence.idiomatic: Look! They are a perfect match. They were meant to be together.

word.literal: a perfect match between a man and a woman

sentence.idiomatic: They are not the perfect couple, but they are very happy.
He is very accomplished; at a young age he had already become a famous entrepreneur.
Other than talking big, he has no other skills.
What kind of skills does he have to get the opportunity to collaborate with that company?
Beethoven is a musician acknowledged by all.
Experts unanimously accept this as the most advanced technique in the world.
He is generally recognized as the greatest leader for his outstanding achievements.
The company can excuse you if you have to leave because of an urgent matter.
Excuse me for a moment, I have to answer this phone call.
I'm not feeling well; please excuse me for leaving.
Hello, Mr. Chen. It’s a pleasure to meet you. I’m very honored to be able to meet you today.
Oh, you flatter me. Excuse me, your name is…?
My last name is Zhang. Here's my business card. Your cocktail party tonight is a huge success. All of your guests are saying that you planned it so perfectly.

I have to thank you all for coming! Also, all the credit for tonight's cocktail party goes to my wife. If she heard what you said, she would be very pleased. Come, I will introduce the two of you. Xiao Lin, this is Miss Zhang.
Hello Miss Zhang. Are you enjoying yourself? Please bear with us if our preparations fall short.

word.literal: a perfect match between a man and a woman

sentence.idiomatic: No, not at all. Mrs. Chen, you are so proficient. Every detail of tonight's cocktail party is perfect – it’s my honor to attend. You are so beautiful. You and Mr. Chen are a perfect match.

Oh my, you flatter us, Miss Zhang. If you're having a good time then we're happy. The friends who came today are all in this profession and everyone certainly has many interesting things to talk about. Miss Zhang, you are so young but it looks like you are very competent.
Yes, I just saw her business card. She is a high level manager of a Fortune 500 company. I can’t help but to admit that I’m getting old.
Mr. Chen, you're too modest. Everyone acknowledges your achievements. We hope that in the future you will keep on looking after the young people like us.
Of course! Ah, excuse me, there are some friends over there that we need to say hello to. Excuse us please.
Miss Zhang, please enjoy yourself.

word.literal: don't deserve it, you flatter me
a perfect match between a man and a woman
sorry to have to leave, excuse me
yellow rice or millet wine; Shaoxing wine
Andy Lau, famous Hong Kong singer and actor
